newsitem.title: HONG KONG: INSIGHT - Hang Seng breaks out of triangle.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Hang Seng breaks out of triangle.

text.p: The Hang Seng Index appears to have broken out of its triangle pattern formed over the past six months and is launched on a new pattern, which analysts using Eliot Wave Theory said should take the index above 11,600 toward 12,000.
Chris Roberts, regional technical analyst at HSBC James Capel, said the index's break out from the 11,265 resistance level was significant.
"For the first time since the market began its triangle formation in February, a prior high has been taken out," he said.
"If you look at the individual charts, you will see that a lot of stocks are moving to new highs and that is very encouraging," he added.
HSBC Holdings, CITIC Pacific, Henderson Land, have all hit new highs in the past week.
"The market appears to be on course to rise above 12,000 in the fourth quarter," Roberts said.

This analysis is part of his long-term view -- using Eliot Wave Theory -- that the index's current move is part of the market's bull run, an advance that began in January 1995 and has yet to be completed.
"The bull run that began at 6,890 is still not completed. We are in the fifth wave up now," he said.
Roberts said there was a good bit of resistance between 11,900 and 12,599 and the market will need something extra to lift it beyond this all-time, intra-day high.
In line with his view that this is the final leg up, he said he would be watchful above the 12,000 level.

Eliot Wave International, referring to the short and long-term outlook for the market, said in a report: "The market's rise from 10,533 is an extending third wave within the larger advance from 10,230 (on March 13).
"There still should be further upside acceleration within this third wave. Resistance at 11,518 is where the rise from 10,533 equals the 10,230-11,215 rally," it said.
"Longer term, the advance from the March 1996 low is wave five and should eventually carry above 11,600 toward 12,000," the report said.
